page.title: 04MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (3)
page.content: After the pay desk, in the 13th century{Southern Tower,}we come into the{Lower Ward.}On either side of this tower are slits in the walls, where there would have been guards. To strengthen these defences from the south side a cannon was brought in about 1462. Part-way up the 198 steps we come to{Sir George de Carteret's Rampart, where we can see his coat-of-arms engraved on the great wall. Carrying on up the main steps we come to an arch with a notice saying that Prince Albert visited the castle in 1846. On up the steps we pass another arch, with three coats-of-arms, those of Queen Elizabeth 1 and the Paulets (Governors of Jersey) above it. After {Queen Elizabeth's Gate,}built in 1593, we pass through{St. George's Tower, built in the 13th century.
